from azure.identity import DefaultAzureCredential
import pyodbc, struct

# Uncomment one of the two lines depending on the identity type
credential = DefaultAzureCredential() # system-assigned identity
# credential = DefaultAzureCredential(managed_identity_client_id='rayfelipe@microsoft.com') # user-assigned identity
# credential = DefaultAzureCredential(managed_identity_client_id='raysynapsemgdvnet') # user-assigned identity

# Get token for Azure SQL Database and convert to UTF-16-LE for SQL Server driver
token = credential.get_token("https://database.windows.net/.default").token.encode("UTF-16-LE")
# token = credential.get_token("https://raysynapsemgdvnet.sql.azuresynapse.net/.default").token.encode("UTF-16-LE")

# token = credential.get_token("sqlserver://rayfelipesynapseworkspace.sql.azuresynapse.net").token.encode("UTF-16-LE")
token_struct = struct.pack(f'<I{len(token)}s', len(token), token)

# Connect with the token
SQL_COPT_SS_ACCESS_TOKEN = 1256
connString = f"Driver={{ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server}};SERVER=rayfelipesynapseworkspace.sql.azuresynapse.net;DATABASE=master"
conn = pyodbc.connect(connString, attrs_before={SQL_COPT_SS_ACCESS_TOKEN: token_struct})
